member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.XamEanUpcBarcode.AddBarsUpcA(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bars upc A. The symbol length in modules UPCA - 113 Logical Structure of an EAN-13 or UPC-A Bar Code Symbol (Excluding Quiet Zones) Left Guard Bar Pattern - Characters 12 Through 7(Left Half) - Centre Guard Bar Pattern - Characters 6 Through 1(Right Half) - Right Guard Bar Pattern 3 modules ---------------- 42 modules (6x7) -----------------5 modules -------------------- 42 modules (6x7)----------------- 3 modules Total number of modules = 95

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.XamEanUpcBarcode.AddBarsEan13(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bars ean13. The symbol length in modules for Ean13 type is 113.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.XamEanUpcBarcode.AddBarsEan8(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bars ean8. The symbol length in modules Ean8: 81 Logical Structure of an EAN-8 Bar Code Symbol Excluding Quiet Zones Left Guard Bar Pattern - Characters 12 Through 7(Left Half) - Centre Guard Bar Pattern - Characters 6 Through 1(Right Half) - Right Guard Bar Pattern 3 modules --------------------28 modules (4x7)----------------- 5 modules ------------------28 modules ----------------------------(4x7) 3 modules Total number of modules = 67

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.XamEanUpcBarcode.AddBarsUpcE(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bars upc E. Logical Structure of a UPC-E Bar Code Symbol Excluding Quiet Zones Left Guard Bar Pattern - Characters 12 Through 7(Left Half) - Centre Guard Bar Pattern - Characters 6 Through 1(Right Half) - Right Guard Bar Pattern 3 modules ---------------------42 modules (6x7) ----------------------6 modules Total number of modules = 51

member.summary: Check whether the value is valid.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.XamGs1DataBarBarcode.DrawBarcode
member.summary: Calculate and draws the barcode elements from the input data. GS1 DataBar is 50% smaller than EAN-13 or UPC-A Bar Code Symbols but carries more information. The first group of GS1 DataBar symbols (next four ones) encodes the Element String AI (01). XamGS1DataBarBarcode supports only linkage flag 0. Component linkage: All GS1 DataBar symbols include a linkage flag. If the linkage flag is 0, then the GS1 DataBar symbol stands alone (no composite 2D barcode associated with the symbol). If the linkage flag is 1, then a 2D Composite. Component and its separator pattern are printed above the GS1 DataBar symbol with the separator pattern aligned and contiguous to the GS1 DataBar symbol.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel defines the four level of Reed-Solomon error correction for the QR Code symbol.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Low
member.summary: Low error correction level allows recovery of 7% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Medium
member.summary: Medium error correction level allows recovery of 15% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Quartil
member.summary: Quartil error correction level allows recovery of 25% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.High
member.summary: High error correction level allows recovery of 30% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.EncodingMode
member.summary: Specifies the encoding mode for compacting the data for the QR Code symbol. The modes are based on the character values and assignments associated with the default ECI (ECI 000003 representing the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.EncodingMode.Undefined
member.summary: When Undefined encoding mode is set, the QR code barcode internally switches between modes as necessary in order to achieve the most efficient conversion of data into a binary string.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.EncodingMode.Numeric
member.summary: Numeric mode encodes data from decimal digit set (0-9). Normally 3 data characters are represented by 10 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.EncodingMode.Alphanumeric
member.summary: Alphanumeric mode encodes data from a set of 45 characters (digits 0-9, upper case letters A-Z, nine other characters: space, $ % * + _ . / : ). Normally two input characters are represented by 11 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.EncodingMode.Byte
member.summary: In Byte mode the data is encoded at 8 bits per character. The character set of the Byte encoding mode is byte data (by default it is ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.EncodingMode.Kanji
member.summary: The Kanji mode efficiently encodes Kanji characters in accordance with the Shift JIS system based on JIS X 0208. Each two-byte character value is compacted to a 13-bit binary codeword.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.Fnc1Mode
member.summary: Fnc1Mode indicator is used for messages containing specific data formats. Fnc1Mode applies to the entire symbol and is not affected by subsequent mode indicators.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.Fnc1Mode.None
member.summary: Do not use any Fnc1 symbols, i.e. the data is not identified according to specific predefined industry or application specifications.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.Fnc1Mode.Gs1
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the first position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordance with the GS1 General Specification.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.Fnc1Mode.Industry
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the second position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordance with a specific industry application previously agreed with AIM Inc.

member.summary: Specify the compaction algorithm in PDF417 which is used to map 8-bit data bytes efficiently to PDF417 codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.CompactionMode.Unspecified
member.summary: Choose internaly which of the three data compaction algorithm in PDF417 is the best compaction mode for the Data value and if necessary combines them.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.CompactionMode.Byte
member.summary: Byte compaction algorithm permits all 256 possible 8-bit byte values to be encoded. This includes all ASCII characters value 0 to 127 inclusive and provides for international character set support. It has compaction ratio of six bytes to five codewords and used as default graphical and control character interpretation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.CompactionMode.Text
member.summary: Text Compaction mode encodes all ASCII chars (32-126) and HT(tab: 9), LF (line feed: 10) and CR (carriage return: 13) symbols. It compacts up to 2 chars per codeword.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.CompactionMode.Numeric
member.summary: Numeric Compaction mode permits efficient encoding of numeric data strings. It should be used to encode long strings of consecutive numeric digits. It encodes up to 2,93 numeric digits per codeword.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.TextSubmode

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.MaxiCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Error Correction Level for MaxiCode symbology

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.MaxiCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Standard
member.summary: Standard Error Correction Level for MaxiCode, encoding 144 codewords, 93 of them are for data encodation, 1 is used for specifying the mode, 50 codewords are used for error correction. 22 erroneously decoded codewords can be corrected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.MaxiCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Enhanced
member.summary: Enhanced Error Correction Level for MaxiCode, encoding 144 codewords, 77 of them are for data encodation, 1 is used for specifying the mode, 66 codewords are used for error correction. 30 erroneously decoded codewords can be corrected.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.ModeIndicator
member.summary: The possible modes values for the MaxiCode control, which allow various structures of the symbol data and error correction. The mode is encoded as part of the Primary Message.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.ModeIndicator.Mode2
member.summary: Mode 2 is used in the transport industry for encoding numeric postal code. The first 120 bits encode the Structured Carrier Message with Enhansed Error Correction. The rest of the symbol is free for other uses and employs Standard Error Correction.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.ModeIndicator.Mode3
member.summary: Mode 3 is designed to be used in the transport industry of an alphanumeric postal code. The first 120 bits encode the Structured Carrier Message with Enhanced Error Correction. The rest of the symbol is free for other uses and employs Standard Error Correction.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.ModeIndicator.Mode4
member.summary: Mode 4 is for Standard symbol encoding. It indicates that the symbol employs EEC in the Primary Message and SEC for the Secondary Message. It provides 93 codewords for data encodation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.ModeIndicator.Mode5
member.summary: Mode 5 encode full message using ECC. It provides 77 codewords for data encodation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.ModeIndicator.Mode6
member.summary: Mode 6 is used for reader programming. The symbol encodes a msg used to program the reader system and SEC is used for the Secondary Message. No data shall be transmitted.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Barcodes.CodeSet.A
member.summary: Code Set A is the default code set at the start of every MaxiCOde symbol.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.BarsFillMode
member.summary: BarsFillMode specifies how the grid fills within the barcode control dimensions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.BarsFillMode.FillSpace
member.summary: FillSpace mode ensures that the barcode grid fills the control dimensions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.BarsFillMode.EnsureEqualSize
member.summary: EnsureEqualSize mode ensures that every grid column/row has the same pixels number width/height. The sum of all columns/rows pixels may be less than the width/height of the control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Code128CodeType
member.summary: Code128 types of barcode

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Code128CodeType.Standard
member.summary: CODE128 standard encodation. No FNC1 in first or second symbol character position after Start character.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Code128CodeType.Ucc
member.summary: GS1-128 (also known as UCC/EAN-128) - encode full list of AI (Application Id). FNC1 in first symbol character position after Start character

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.EncodingMode
member.summary: Specifies the encoding mode for compacting the data for the QR Code symbol. The modes are based on the character values and assignments associated with the default ECI (ECI 000003 representing the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.EncodingMode.Undefined
member.summary: When Undefined encoding mode is set, the QR code barcode internally switches between modes as necessary in order to achieve the most efficient conversion of data into a binary string.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.EncodingMode.Numeric
member.summary: Numeric mode encodes data from decimal digit set (0-9). Normally 3 data characters are represented by 10 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.EncodingMode.Alphanumeric
member.summary: Alphanumeric mode encodes data from a set of 45 characters (digits 0-9, upper case letters A-Z, nine other characters: space, $ % * + _ . / : ). Normally two input characters are represented by 11 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.EncodingMode.Byte
member.summary: In Byte mode the data is encoded at 8 bits per character. The character set of the Byte encoding mode is byte data (by default it is ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.EncodingMode.Kanji
member.summary: The Kanji mode efficiently encodes Kanji characters in accordance with the Shift JIS system based on JIS X 0208. Each two-byte character value is compacted to a 13-bit binary codeword.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Fnc1Mode
member.summary: Fnc1Mode indicator is used for messages containing specific data formats. Fnc1Mode applies to the entire symbol and is not affected by subsequent mode indicators.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Fnc1Mode.None
member.summary: Do not use any Fnc1 symbols, i.e. the data is not identified according to specific predefined industry or application specifications.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Fnc1Mode.Gs1
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the first position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordance with the GS1 General Specification.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Fnc1Mode.Industry
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the second position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordance with a specific industry application previously agreed with AIM Inc.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Medium
member.summary: Medium error correction level allows recovery of 15% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Quartil
member.summary: Quartil error correction level allows recovery of 25% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.High
member.summary: High error correction level allows recovery of 30% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.UltraQRCodeBarcode.EciNumber
member.summary: Each Extended Channel Interpretation (ECI) is designated by a six-digit assignment number: 000000 - 999999. The default value depends on the loaded encodings. The default is ECI 000003 (representing ISO/IEC 8859-1) if the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set is loaded. Otherwise the default value is 000026 (representing UTF-8).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.WindowsForms.strings.UltraQRCodeBarcode_EciNumber_Property
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Gets or sets the Extended Channel Interpretation. Each Extended Channel Interpretation (ECI) is designated by a six-digit assignment number: 000000 - 999999. The default value depends on the loaded encodings. The default is ECI 000003 (representing ISO/IEC 8859-1) if the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set is loaded. Otherwise the default value is 000026 (representing UTF-8)..
